page.title: 01The Colmonell Area
page.content: Colmonell is a small village (population 154) situated in the valley of the river Stinchar in south Ayrshire. It is a village with many links with the past as can be seen by the castles which virtually encircle it.The ruins of Craigneil to the south,Knockdolian to the west and Kirkhill in the heart of the village all bear witness to the areas past history. The parish church is believed to have been established by Colmon,a follower of St Ninian who was perhaps Scotland's first missionary in around 400 AD.The church is justifably famous for its fine stained glass windows and also for it's churchyard which contains the remains of Matthew McLlwraith,a martyr of Covenanter times.
